job_title: SIEM Engineer ‚Äì SOC Tooling & Detection Enablement
job_description:
Responsibilities: Job profile
The SIEM Engineer owns the design, implementation, and health of the SOC monitoring platform(s), ensuring reliable log collection, normalization, alerting, dashboards, and retention across ASA entities. The role partners with SOC analysts to enable effective detections and supports continuous tuning to improve fidelity and coverage.

Responsibilities
- SIEM Platform Operations: Install/configure and maintain SIEM components (e.g., Wazuh manager/indexer/dashboards), ensure availability, performance, and secure configuration.
- Log Source Onboarding: Onboard and maintain telemetry from endpoints/servers, identity providers, email systems, firewalls/VPNs, network devices, and critical applications; validate log completeness and parsing.
- Detection Engineering Support: Create, tune, and maintain detection rules/use cases; optimize for reduced false positives and improved detection of high-risk scenarios.
- Dashboards & Reporting: Build operational and executive dashboards; enable scheduled reporting for SOC KPIs and risk insights.
- Data Management: Manage retention, indexing, storage capacity planning, and data integrity; ensure time synchronization and consistent log formats.
- Automation & Integrations: Integrate SIEM with ticketing/case management, EDR, and other tools to support workflow automation and enrichment (where available).
- Documentation & Standards: Maintain documentation for architecture, log source inventory, parsing, rule sets, and operating procedures; support audit evidence requests.
- Continuous Improvement: Identify telemetry gaps, propose improvements, and support rollout of monitoring standards across countries.

Core competencies
- Strong engineering discipline and troubleshooting capability.
- Ability to translate detection requirements into technical configurations.
- Good stakeholder collaboration: works effectively with analysts and IT teams to onboard logs and resolve issues.
- Documentation discipline and attention to detail.

Compensation & Benefits:
- Competitive and attractive salary package will be offered to deserving candidates based on experience and skill set.
- Festival Bonus
- Provident Fund & Gratuity
- Life & Health Insurance (IPD & OPD)
- Annual Health Check-up
- Baisakhi Allowance
- Vehicle Loan Scheme / Vehicle Maintenance Allowance

Requirements: Required knowledge and Technical Skills

- Hands-on SIEM administration and engineering.
- Log collection agents, syslog, Windows Event Forwarding concepts, and parsing/normalization.
- Linux administration, scripting (Python/Bash), and basic network troubleshooting.
- Understanding of common security telemetry sources (EDR, IAM/M365, firewalls, proxies, DNS) and how to use them for detection.
- Secure hardening practices for SIEM infrastructure and supporting components.

Education and Experience:

- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Cyber Security/ Engineering/IT/Information Security or similar.
- 4‚Äì8 years‚Äô experience in SIEM/monitoring eng

Responsibilities: Responsibilities
‚ñ∏ SOC Operations & Governance: Establish and run SOC processes (24/7 or 8x5 + on-call), shift handovers, case management standards, and escalation paths.
‚ñ∏ Incident Response Management: Lead and coordinate incident response activities across entities; run incident bridges, ensure evidence capture, and drive root-cause analysis and post-incident reviews.
‚ñ∏ Stakeholder Management: Interface with local IT teams, Risk/Compliance, and senior management; provide clear updates during incidents and routine operational reporting.
Career at ASA International
Career at ASA International Dhaka, Bangladesh
‚ñ∏ Detection & Monitoring Oversight: Ensure high reliability alerting by overseeing SIEM content, use-case coverage (e.g., privileged access abuse, malware, suspicious logins, data exfiltration), and noise reduction.
‚ñ∏ Platform Ownership (oversight): Ensure SOC tooling health and coverage (SIEM, EDR/XDR, email security, identity logs, network/security devices), including onboarding of critical log sources and maintaining documentation.
‚ñ∏ Threat & Vulnerability Alignment: Work with Vulnerability Management and relevant teams to ensure detection and response is aligned to critical vulnerabilities, emerging threats, and risk priorities.
‚ñ∏ Quality Assurance: Review investigation quality, closure codes, and adherence to SOPs/playbooks; coach analysts and enforce consistent standards.
‚ñ∏ Metrics & Continuous Improvement: Own SOC KPIs (MTTA/MTTR, alert-to-incident ratio, false positive rate, coverage), drive improvements, and support audit/regulator evidence requests.
‚ñ∏ People Leadership: Train and mentor L1/L2 analysts; manage performance goals, shift rotas, and professional development.

Core competencies
‚ñ∏ Security Skills: Firewall Configuration, Policy Creating, Access Control List (ACL), VPN, SSL VPN, IPSEC VPN, URL filtering, Application Control, Web Application firewall operation, Privilege Access Management (PAM), SIEM, Two factor authentication, (2FA), VAPT tools, Load Balancing, Bandwidth Control, SSL Certificate report and log monitoring, regular configuration Backup and restore. Centralized Antivirus Operation, report, Control, Group Management. Web SSL certificate deployment etc.
‚ñ∏ System Deployment Knowledge: Installing and configuring Windows Server, Operation, Log/Event Check, Monitoring, data backup, OS update etc. Managing Clustered System, Guest VM monitoring. Good understanding of Virtualization, System Design, Plan, MPIO, ISCSI etc.
‚ñ∏ Network-System Design: Making Network Diagram, Creating and Making IP Plan, Product Selection for network, server and consumer products.
‚ñ∏ Networking Skills: Layer 2 and Layer 3 Switch configuration, Skills on SSH, VLAN, Inter VLAN Routing, Spanning Tree, Routing Protocol (static and dynamic), Device Hardening, GRE Tunnel, IPSec VPN, Interfaces, Device Configuration backup and restore etc.
‚ñ∏ Licensing and Subscription: Windows OS (Server and PC) licensing, Microsoft Office Licensi

Responsibilities: Core Responsibilities
- Handle day-to-day accounting (cash, bank, petty cash, journals)
- Prepare event-wise budgets and track actual vs planned cost
- Manage vendor bills, advances, and final settlements
- Issue client invoices and follow up for payments (this is critical)
- Maintain receivables & payables reports

Event-Specific Duties
- Control event-wise expense tracking (fabrication, manpower, logistics, F&B, artists, etc.)
- Verify vendor quotations, PO, and bills before payment
- Ensure on-site cash disbursement is documented properly
- Close accounts event-by-event after execution

Financial Control & Compliance
- Maintain VAT, Tax, TDS records
- Assist in monthly closing & audit support
- Ensure company policies are followed in spending
- Maintain proper bill files & digital records

Coordination & Reporting
- Coordinate with Project Managers & Operations team
- Prepare profit/loss reports per event
- Submit management financial reports
- Support decision-making with cost insights

Tools & Skills Expected
- Strong in Excel / Google Sheets
- Knowledge of Tally / accounting software
- Good understanding of event costing
- Detail-oriented, deadline-driven mindset

Requirements: Requirements
- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accounting / Finance / Business Administration
- 2‚Äì4 years experience in accounts (event/agency experience = big plus)
- Strong knowledge of basic accounting principles
- Hands-on experience with Tally / accounting software
- Excellent command over MS Excel / Google Sheets
- Ability to manage event-wise costing & expense tracking
- Knowledge of VAT, Tax & compliance (practical, not textbook)
- Experience handling vendor bills, payments & client invoicing
- Strong attention to detail and accuracy
- Ability to work under tight deadlines & pressure (events don‚Äôt wait)
- Good communication & coordination skills
- Honest, organized, and responsible mindset

Optional (Adds Extra Value)
- Experience in event management / advertising agency
- Knowledge of petty cash & on-site cash handling
- Understanding of budget control & P/L reporting

No need to overpromise. You want someone who can control money when chaos is happening on-ground. That‚Äôs the real game.

job_description:
Responsibilities: Assist in the overall department management and achieve sales targets through regular monitoring, improved customer service, and team motivation. Main Responsibilities Daily Responsibilities Motivate the department team to achieve sales targets. Ensure proper product display, merchandising, and shelf management. Monitor store inventory, product requisition, and customer service, and provide feedback to the store in-charge. Participate in store meetings, identify areas for improvement, and plan for sales and operational quality enhancement. Weekly Responsibilities Plan and implement merchandising, product display, and customer service flow to increase sales. Provide weekly feedback to the area manager following store management guidelines. Coordinate with the store in-charge to ensure product availability according to the designated time. Maintain shelf maintenance according to the display plan and ensure improved customer service. Monthly Responsibilities Participate in HR training programs and encourage team participation. Ensure compliance with company SOP and stock/inventory management policies. Assist management in staff replacement/recruitment as needed. Maintain cleanliness, security, and healthy environment in the store. Assist in stock verification, variance analysis, and expense control. Initiate team development and performance improvement. Annual Responsibilities Follow the Annual Business Plan (ABP) as directed by the area in-charge/manager. Ensure achievement of sales KPI and HR KPI as per company objectives.

Requirements: Minimum Qualifications and Skills Educational Qualification: Minimum SSC Skills: Good verbal communication skills Customer service attitude Proactive and hardworking mentality Experience: No prior experience required (training will be provided) General Responsibilities and Terms Must follow company objectives, policies, and SOPs. May need to take on additional responsibilities and collaborate with other departments when necessary. Must be adaptable to changes in any unit/branch as per management decisions. Must maintain professional conduct and uphold the company's image at all times. Permanent employees must provide a 60-day notice before resigning. Behavioral Expectations Maintain a professional image and attitude in line with the company's values. Show respect to colleagues and customers. Uphold the company's reputation both inside and outside working hours. Duty and Benefits Working Hours: 9 hours (1 day off per week) Festival bonus Sales incentives Confirmation benefit after 6 months Annual increment and promotion opportunities Monthly team dinner In-house training facilities
